abstract.para: The &ostack; project provides a variety of command line tools with which you can manage the services within your cloud and automate administration tasks by using scripts. Each of the core &ostack; components has its own command line tool.

sect1.title: &ostack; RC File
sect1.para: To set the necessary environment variables for the &ostack; command line tools, you need to download and source an environment file, openrc.sh. It is project-specific and contains the credentials used by ∁, &img;, and &ident; services. You can download it from the &cloud; ‐.

procedure.title: Downloading the &ostack; RC File

step.para: taroth 2012-08-02: DEVs, can I download the openrc file as admin only? or as any user? Log in to the &cloud; ‐.
In the top-level row of the main screen, click Settings &ostack; Credentials .
Select the project for which you want to download the &ostack; RC file, click Download RC File and save the file.
Copy the openrc.sh file to the machine on which you want execute &ostack; commands, like uploading an image with the glance command.

sect2.title: Building Images with &susestudio;
sect2.para: To build the images to use within the cloud, use &susestudio; or &suseonsite;. For detailed information on how to build appliance images, refer to the &suseonsite; Quick Start or the &suseonsite; User Guide, available at .

note.title: Image Requirements
note.para: Make sure any images that you build for the cloud fulfill the following requirements:

listitem.para: The network is set to DHCP.
The image does not include &yast;2 Firstboot.
The image does not include any end-user license agreements (EULA) dialogs.

The image contains the following package: suse-ami-tools. The ami tools are used for communication with the metadata API taroth 2012-08-01: DEVs, in &ostack;? and to pull keypairs into the virtual machine that will run the image.
The image has the following format: USB/Harddisk.

step.para: Download the disk image from &susestudio; and convert it into the qcow2 format (on a machine that has the virt-utils installed):
step.screen: qemu -img convert -c -f raw -O qcow2 image_file final_image_file

step.screen: glance add name="image_name" is_public=True container_format=bare \ disk_format=qcow2 < path_to_final_image_file
step.para: Glance does not check any image properties during upload, therefore you need to specify the image's properties as command line options.

note.title: Updating Images
note.para: After having uploaded an image to &cloud;, the image contents cannot be modified (onyl the image's metadata). To update image contents, you need to delete the current image and upload a modified version of the image.

sect2.para: To modify the metadata of an image, use the glance update command.
